abstract.text: A session that continues to run your app after the user has stopped interacting.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: With extended runtime sessions, your app continues to run after the user stops interacting with it. The app can continue to communicate with Bluetooth devices, process data, or play sounds or haptics, even after the watch’s screen turns off.
Each app can support a single type of extended runtime session: self care, mindfulness, physical therapy, or smart alarm. Select the session by enabling the appropriate Background Modes capability.

abstract.text: Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
A session that continues to run your app after the user has stopped interacting.
A delegate object for monitoring the session and responding to state changes and errors.
The time and date when the session expires.
Stops the session.
Play a repeating haptic alert.
Instantiates a new session object.
Starts running the session.
Schedules a session to start running at a future date.
The session’s current state.
A set of optional methods for monitoring an extended runtime session.
The error codes reported by extended runtime sessions.
The domain for errors reported by extended runtime sessions.
The activation states for an extended runtime session.
Manage background sessions and tasks.
Keep your complications up-to-date by reading values from a Bluetooth peripheral while your app is running in the background.

doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/W.title: Interacting with Bluetooth peripherals during background app refresh

abstract.text: Receive and respond to life-cycle notifications.
Handle scheduled update tasks in the background, and respond to background system interactions including Siri intents and incoming Bluetooth messages.
Create an extended runtime session that continues running your app after the user stops interacting with it.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
